intro: Hieracium amplifolium, commonly known as the broadleaf hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. It features lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture and produces yellow flowers that bloom from June to September. Hieracium amplifolium is often found in temperate regions and is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
